links.body: The Siege of the North, Part 2

paragraphs.body: This realm, located in the ${link_0}, is home to an ancient entity known as ${link_1}.
paragraphs.text: This realm, located in the Spirit World, is home to an ancient entity known as Koh.

paragraphs.body: While seeking spiritual assistance in repelling the ${link_0} ${link_1} from the ${link_2} during their ${link_3}, ${link_4} consulted Koh within his lair. He was told that the ${link_5} and ${link_6} Spirits were under the threat of complete expulsion, which could prove disastrous for the ${link_7}'s resistance.
paragraphs.text: While seeking spiritual assistance in repelling the Fire Nation Navy from the Northern Water Tribe during their siege, Aang consulted Koh within his lair. He was told that the Moon and Ocean Spirits were under the threat of complete expulsion, which could prove disastrous for the Water Tribe's resistance.

paragraphs.body: Aang spiritually contacted ${link_0} ${link_1} in the realm of Koh when he was in a coma caused by ${link_2}'s ${link_3}. Kuruk asked him if he had seen a beautiful woman with long brown hair. Aang responded by inquiring about Kuruk's dilemma, at which time Kuruk proceeded to tell him the story of his wife, ${link_4}. After the tale, Aang realized that during his encounter with Koh, one of the spirit's faces was that of the woman Kuruk had described. Heartened by the knowledge of where his wife was, Kuruk set off to track down Koh once again.
paragraphs.text: Aang spiritually contacted Avatar Kuruk in the realm of Koh when he was in a coma caused by Azula's lightning attack. Kuruk asked him if he had seen a beautiful woman with long brown hair. Aang responded by inquiring about Kuruk's dilemma, at which time Kuruk proceeded to tell him the story of his wife, Ummi. After the tale, Aang realized that during his encounter with Koh, one of the spirit's faces was that of the woman Kuruk had described. Heartened by the knowledge of where his wife was, Kuruk set off to track down Koh once again.
Koh's lair was visited by Aang in 100 AG.

paragraphs.body: The only way to access Koh's realm is through a spirit gate. The realm is an eerie place inhabited by a wide variety of spirit creatures, including the giant wolf and ${link_0}. At the center of this realm is a large, gnarled tree with roots that extend into the sky, rather than into the ground. Surrounding it is a large ravine shrouded in dense mist, though the fog is pierced by tall pinnacles of stone.
paragraphs.text: The only way to access Koh's realm is through a spirit gate. The realm is an eerie place inhabited by a wide variety of spirit creatures, including the giant wolf and curly-tailed blue nose. At the center of this realm is a large, gnarled tree with roots that extend into the sky, rather than into the ground. Surrounding it is a large ravine shrouded in dense mist, though the fog is pierced by tall pinnacles of stone.

paragraphs.body: Deep below the gigantic tree is Koh's lair, formally named the Temple of Koh. Although most local spirits do not dare go near it, an unspecified feature of the cave is prone to luring strangers in. When seeking Koh, one must venture into his lair with great caution, making sure not to show any sign of emotion. Koh attempts to scare his visitors by continually changing faces in the hope that they will express emotion so that he can steal that individual's face.
